intro: Aster novi-belgii, commonly known as the New Belgium aster, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens. The flowers bloom in late summer to early fall, adding vibrant color to the landscape.
